DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study compare two accepted method pain control knee arthroplasty surgery.The first method combine periarticular injection ropivacaine continuous blockade femoral nerve.The second method use periarticular infiltration ropivacaine combination bolus ropivacaine intraarticular catheter place intraoperatively follow continuous intraarticular infusion ropivacaine . All patient also receive sustained-release oral opioid oral rescue opioids determine pain severity use Visual Analog Scale ( VAS )
DOC.criteria: Elective primary knee arthroplasty ASA I , II , & III patient Spinal Anaesthesia Patients refuse consent Contraindications regional anaesthesia Preexisting neurological disease Alcohol drug abuse Inability use outcome assessment tool Wheel chair walker dependent Pregnancy
